alert.note: Alert for Washington (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 11 at 10:41AM EDT until July 12 at 6:26AM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Vermont... Winooski River At Waterbury affecting Washington County. For the Winooski River...including Moretown, Montpelier, Waterbury, Essex Junction...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Winooski River at Waterbury. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...Water will continue to flood low lying parking lots at the Waterbury State Office complex, and Rowe Field in Waterbury. Downstream in Richmond, Bridge Street at the Winooski bridge near the Round Church will continue to be inundated, and the Richmond public park will continue to flood. The river will be out of its banks from Waterbury downstream through Richmond, with considerable field flooding until the level falls below 421.0 feet. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM EDT Tuesday the stage was 425.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 419.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:15 AM EDT Tuesday was 426.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 425.7 feet late this morning. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 419.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1045 PM EDT.
